quotes.quote: Stop trying to impress other people, they're more screwed up than you think.
Life is a lot more easier when you are living it to impress your positive inner-self. Most people are quite hard to impress; so why waste your time and energy trying to impress them?
Don't try to impress people. Always be yourself!
Who do we set out to impress? Ourselves?  Or others?
We might impress people with our strengths, but we connect with people through our weaknesses.
Why do you think the old stories tell of men who set out on great journeys to impress the gods? Because trying to impress people just isn't worth the time and effort.
Always put your best foot forward. Not to impress others, but to impress and respect yourself.
Spend a little more time trying to make something of yourself and a little less time trying to impress people
If you can't impress them with your argument, impress them with your actions.
The desire to impress others is one of the worst forms of mental imprisonment.

The more you try to impress, the more you become depressed, and the more they get tired of your coercion. It doesn't make them love you, instead, they'll see you as a little child, trying to draw a senseless picture on a piece of paper, begging people to look at it and admire it by force. You can persuade someone to look at your face, but you can't persuade them to see the beauty therein.
Impress people with your accomplishments, not your possessions.
Do not impress others at the expense of your progress.
Too many people spend money they haven't earned to buy things they don't want to impress people they don't like.
Trying to impress people who hate you is just a big waste of time.
We sometimes try to impress people we just met by not trying to impress them.
One reason why birds and horses are happy is because they are not trying to impress other birds and horses.
The desire to impress is an efficient means of bringing out one's least impressive qualities.
Never try to impress a woman, because if you do, she'll expect you to keep up the standard for the rest of your life.
The less you try to impress, the more impressive you are.
If you always try to be cautious and careful, you will never impress anyone.
If the whole world was blind how many people would you impress?
Don't worry about trying to impress peopleâ€¦ Just focus on how you can add value to their lives.
There's a time to impress someone, and then there's a time to make an impression on someone.
Impress people with your soul, not the things you have.
Everyone wants to impress somebodyâ€¦ - That's how it works!
The times you impress me the most are the times when you don't try.
You are not free until you have no need to impress anybody.
Some people try very hard to impress others but in the bargain lose their own identity
The need to impress others causes half the world's woes. Don't add to them. Be real, not impressive.

I try to keep in my mind the simple question: Am I trying to do good or make myself good? Too many of our responsibilities get added to our plate when we are trying to please people, impress people, prove ourselves, acquire power, increase our prestige. All those motivations are about looking good more than doing good.
